description: Comprehensive training dataset for loop iteration (q:loop)

loop_types.range: ✅ Fully covered (3 basic + edge cases + nested)
loop_types.array: ✅ Fully covered (3 basic + nested + state management)

features.nested_loops: ✅ ADDED (4 examples: multiplication table, grid, matrix, hierarchical)
features.conditional_filtering: ✅ ADDED (5 examples: filter, categorize, search, multi-level)
features.state_management: ✅ ADDED (6 examples: sum, count, concat, max, product, filter)
features.edge_cases: ✅ ADDED (7 examples: empty, single, large, negative)
features.real_world_ui: ✅ ADDED (7 examples: tables, menus, pagination, grids, forms, badges, CSV)

training_readiness.notes: Comprehensive coverage of loop patterns with 36 positive examples showing multiple implementation styles. Covers basic, intermediate, and advanced use cases. Includes real-world UI patterns and data processing scenarios.
recommended_additions: Object property iteration examples (when feature is implemented)

positive: positive/array_loops.json (3 examples) - Array iteration with/without index
positive/loops_with_conditionals.json (5 examples) - Filtering and conditional logic
positive/loops_with_state.json (6 examples) - Accumulators and state management
positive/edge_cases.json (7 examples) - Boundary conditions and edge cases
positive/real_world_patterns.json (7 examples) - UI rendering and data processing
negative: negative/invalid_syntax.json (5 examples) - Common errors and validation

usage_instructions.for_llm_training: Use positive examples for code generation training. Show LLM multiple ways to solve same problem (e.g., filtering can use if inside loop vs building new array). Negative examples teach error detection and validation.
usage_instructions.for_developers: Reference these examples when learning q:loop. See progression from basic to advanced. Real-world patterns show production usage.
usage_instructions.for_testing: Automated tests should mirror these examples. Each example represents a valid test case.

example_diversity.implementation_styles: Shows 3-7 different approaches per pattern type
example_diversity.use_cases: Data processing, UI rendering, filtering, accumulation, hierarchical data
example_diversity.multiple_solutions: Same problem solved different ways (e.g., counting, filtering, building strings)
